message:
Well, to me, async and await have everything to do with threads, because if you use them incorrectly, you deadlock. Deadlocks do not happen in single threaded applications.

You and I will have to politely disagree on this, I guess. I shouldn't have to modify calling or called methods in order to prevent a deadlock. It is completely unreasonable.

The requirement that I use the async keyword all the way up and down falls well short of the encapsulation that an OO language like C# is supposed to provide.
